TopicTitle: Thinking of setting up my own RP forum, what do you think?

Articles.Content:
Inspired by the KSP RP forum, I\'m thinking of making my own RP forum.

It would be unrelated to KSP Roleplaying.

It would be set on a whole different planet, with a whole different species.

I\'m not looking to steal members from the KSP RP forum, oh no.

However, since we\'re meant to lessen down the violence on the KSP RP forum, I thought that if I make a forum there\'d be no need to do that on my forum. Now, I\'m not disrespecting the mods, infact I think they made a good decision it that. I mean, it is Kerbal *Space* Program.

I have a prototype map for the planet, what do you guys think?

Also note the planet is about five times the size of earth.

> ![6996185122_dcf9b1446a_b.jpg](http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7091/6996185122_dcf9b1446a_b.jpg)
> Blue is sea.
> 
> White is land.
> 
> Grey is ice.
> 
> Light grey is land covered by ice.

It could be that this is just a terrible idea, and if I know I\'ll get no members or support from you guys, I may just not make it.

But I thought, with the new RP forum, I thought this would be for people who don\'t want to go to space, just continue the nation-rp-thing.

Thanks.

I think it\'s going to be a lot of work. Be ready for drama. Good luck!

I also think having a game master(s) who runs plots and players who are the heros / villians of the story, would make things run a lot smoother and give the entire game an interesting narrative to follow rather then everyone doing their own thing. 

I only do roll playing games with dice and stat based systems. Stats prevent people from pulling deus ex machinas when things aren\'t going their way. 

(I should point out I really don\'t know how the RP is handled here. I\'ve honestly never looked into it.)
